_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility and Regulated Materials
The Airgas National Welders facility located in Charlotte, NC is primarily an acetylene production plant.  Acetylene gas is manufactured at the facility.  Also, various industrial gases are repackaged at the facility by the transfill of cryogenic gases from bulk tanks into compressed gas cylinders.  Some gases, including chlorine, are simply received in cylinders, stored on site, and shipped to customers.   The facility has determined that the quantities of acetylene and chlorine may reach the regulatory thresholds under RMP.  The facility also covers acetylene under its Process Safety Management (PSM) program.   

Airgas National Welders conducts its operations to prevent possible releases or harm to its products, employees and to the surrounding area and residents.  Airgas National Welders implements many Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for the acetylene process and the safe handling of compressed gas cylinders (including chlorine) to prevent any accidental release.  Along with written standard operating procedures, several administrative controls are used.  These include, operator training, emergency procedures, qualification of operators, and inventory control.  

The company uses a Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) as the foundation of the chemical prevention program. The PHA systematically examines the equipment, systems and procedures for handling regulated materials in order to identify the hazards that exist and how to control them. The PHA included a team review of the process using the what-if/checklist methodology to identify hazards, review of previous incidents, verification of controls and the consequences of their failure, review of issues related to sitting and human factors and a qualitative evaluation of failures of control.  

Chlorine
The quantity of chlorine stored on site is being increased due to increased customer demand.  The chlorine is received, handled and shipped in 150 lb cylinders.  No chlorine cylinde

r filling, releasing, transferring, or servicing is part of the normal Airgas National Welders operations.  Airgas National Welders anticipates a maximum inventory of 20,000 pounds of chlorine (134 cylinders @150 lb. each).  Metal pallets with safety straps or hand trucks are used to safely move and store the cylinders.  

The Airgas National Welders facility in Charlotte, NC has not had a reportable chlorine release or accident to date.

Acetylene
Acetylene gas is generated by a process from calcium carbide and water.  The maximum amount of acetylene at the facility is estimated to be 45,000 lbs with no more than 15,000 pounds in a process.

The Airgas National Welders facility in Charlotte, NC has not had an acetylene release or accident within the past 5 years. 

Emergency Response Program
Airgas National Welders has a written Emergency Action Plan that is site specific as well as an Emergency Response Plan to be implemented in case of an accident, release or spill of a hazardous material.  The EAP is a separate document. Airgas National Welders Emergency Response Plan consists of a trained hazardous material response team in accordance with the company's Emergency Response Manual.  The Emergency Response Manual and EAP outline the trained personnel, equipment, and actions that are to be taken in case of a release of a hazardous material.  Hazardous material communication training is also conducted to protect the safety of all employees.

In the event of an acetylene incident, mitigation controls include the Plant Deluge System, the Plant Alarm System, and the employee Evacuation Plan. 

For potential chlorine releases, Airgas National Welders maintains emergency equipment including emergency cylinder repair kits and cylinder containment vessels available for trained responders to stop or contain gas leaks.
